description.narrative: MK Group d.o.o. (the MK Group, or the Group), a leading vertically-integrated agro-industrial conglomerate with vast the majority of its operations in Serbia, has embarked on a 87 million investment plan which comprises: (i) the acquisition of Carnex AD Meat Industry (Carnex), the Serbian brand leader in processed meat products; (ii) the upgrade and expansion of Carnexs vertically-integrated operations; (iii) the expansion and modernization of the Groups primary agriculture operations; and, (iv) permanent working capital to support the growth of the Group''s operations (the Project). The Project will enable the Group to further diversify and expand its operations vertically and horizontally in sectors where it already operates as well as adjacent industries, namely livestock and meat production. Thereby, the Project is expected to increase the size, strength and sustainability of MK Groups operations.

The development impact of the Project is expected to include: (i) Operational turnaround and efficiency improvements at Carnex, a large employer and former regional leader; (ii) Support to an agricultural company involved in value-added production in a sector important to Serbia''s economy; (iii) Extend the MK Goup''s reach to farmers and imporve agricultural infrastructure; (iv) demonstration effect by encouraging other companies to invest in the region; and (vi) increased tax revenues.

name.narrative: With offices in Belgrade and Novi Sad, the Project funds will support MK Groups agriculture-related operations which are concentrated in the northern Serbian province of Vojvodina. Carnexs operations are located in the municipality of Vrbas, also in the Vojvodina province. The Vojvodina province is home to Serbias most fertile land and most of its economy revolves around agribusiness activities.
